text: Hi Manmeet, it’s great to meet you. I’m an ACCA qualified accountant with around fifteen years experience. I’ve worked in a number of different disciplines from statutory accounting, management accounts and analysis and corporate development roles, currently as an M&A banker for an energy focused investment bank.
I’m based in Scotland, so you’ll have to forgive my ignorance when it comes to your system, I’ve got no idea what year 13 is!

A degree apprenticeship is a good idea, particularly for something in finance and accounting. I think PWC (and probably more of the rest of the ‘big 4’ firms) are starting to take apprentices on as well as graduates...

I am running into a meeting shortly, but if you have a think about a few questions, please do send them through, so I can have a better understanding of how i can help. Alternatively, let me know if you’d like me to take the lead....

Hi Andy, how are you doing? Thats fine, here in England its like primary, high school, sixth form/college where year12/13 take place and after year 13 its university or apprenticeships. 
Moreover, I would like to know more about ACCA qualified accountant and wanna get in depth information so I know how exactly accountants works... From the age of 13, i wanted to become accountant, and yeah its all working with numbers. However, i want to do something fun where i do get bored of it... you know what I mean! 
Therefore, if you can please explain further what accountant jobs are like. 
And i wanted to ask what time you get free so we can chat around that time???
I will also tell you about my today’s event, Afternoon tea.

Yup sounds good to me. Unfortunately, I’m stuck in the office and will be for some time! I’ll ping you a message tomorrow and we can catch up some more... I don’t really get free at a specific time, but I’ll do my best to come up with some windows which may work best.
